strengths: Verification pipeline is genuinely excellent -- 148 passing tests across 11 test files covering validators, synthesis extractors, pMap concurrency, component rendering, and SSE hook state machines. TypeScript strict mode with noUncheckedIndexedAccess gives real compile-time guarantees. Every LLM output boundary has validated field access with fallbacks.

Architecture decomposition compounds cleanly -- try-invoke.ts handles multi-turn tool loops, try-debate.ts handles pair selection and revision parsing, try-synthesize.ts extracts and validates LLM synthesis output, all coordinated through route.ts SSE pipeline. isRecord type guard extracted to shared type-guards.ts. 3/6 agents now toolEnabled (Boris, Cat, Thariq).

Compound learning is real and measurable -- 12 iterations tracked with score trajectory from 68.4 to 83.91, 61 of 71 action items resolved. CLAUDE.md is substantive with Common Mistakes, Context Reference Library, and Design System. MEMORY.md captures deployment-specific knowledge.
weaknesses: try-invoke.ts fallback path (lines 329-397) still does NOT use the isRecord type guard from @/lib/type-guards.ts -- it uses inline typeof/null/Array.isArray checks instead of the shared utility.
key={i} index-based keys remain in 4 loading skeleton files. While static skeletons where index keys are harmless, CLAUDE.md explicitly discourages index keys.
Lydia agent still lacks toolEnabled despite being Opus-tier. With Boris, Cat, and Thariq now tool-enabled, Lydia is the last Opus agent without code investigation capability.

action_items.action: Refactor try-invoke.ts fallback path (lines 329-397) to use extractNumber/extractStringArray/extractActionItems from try-synthesize.ts instead of inline type narrowing.
action_items.impact: Eliminates ~40 lines of duplicated validation logic, improves consistency.

action_items.action: Enable toolEnabled: true for the Lydia agent in try-agents.ts and add search_codebase/read_file tool instructions to her system prompt.
action_items.impact: 4/6 agents with deep code investigation capability.

action_items.action: Add integration tests for the debate pipeline (try-debate.ts) -- parseRevisions, identifyDebatePairs, and the SCORE_REVISION_BOUND constraint.
action_items.impact: The debate system is a key differentiator. Testing its core logic would add ~8-10 tests.

action_items.action: Add tests for applyRevisions function in route.ts -- it modifies agent scores, recalculates composites, and re-derives grades/verdicts.
action_items.impact: Score revision application is a correctness-critical path. Currently untested.

agents.one_line: Real compound learning across 12 iterations, genuinely strong verification with 148 tests and strict TypeScript, clean module decomposition -- with a few remaining DRY violations in the fallback path to clean up.

strengths: The 'Try It Now' zero-install flow is the best adoption decision in this project -- paste a GitHub URL, get a 6-agent panel review with radar chart, strengths/weaknesses, and prioritized action items, all without installing anything. Example repos as one-click buttons reduce friction further.

Copy Link share button in PanelSynthesisView.tsx resolves iter-11 P1 and creates a viral loop -- users can share audit results with teammates. Clean implementation with clipboard API, 'Copied!' feedback state, and permalink-friendly URLs.

Board Builder at boards/build/page.tsx is a 503-line fully functional panel editor with useReducer state management, weight rebalancing, YAML export, and local save -- transforms BoardClaude from a single-use tool into a platform.
weaknesses: Board Builder still has no preview pane -- iter-11 P3 remains unresolved. Users configure agents/weights/criteria but cannot see what their panel's output would look like. A mock radar chart would close the feedback loop.
No sticky Install CLI button in the global header nav -- iter-11 P2 is unresolved. Users who arrive via shared result link or Try page have to scroll to homepage bottom for install instructions.
Install path requires git clone + bash script (Linux/macOS only). No PowerShell equivalent, no npm/npx install. Windows developers face unnecessary friction.

action_items.action: Add a preview pane to the Board Builder page showing a mock RadarChart with configured agent names and weights as dimensions. Chronic open item across 2 iterations.
action_items.impact: Closes feedback loop in the builder. Affects adoption_path (+2-3) and user_value (+1-2).

action_items.action: Add a persistent 'Install CLI' button or link in the global nav header that anchors to #install on homepage or links to a dedicated /install page.
action_items.impact: Captures conversion intent from any page. Affects adoption_path (+2).

action_items.action: Create an install.ps1 PowerShell equivalent of install.sh, or provide an npx boardclaude init command, and document both in README.
action_items.impact: Removes platform-specific friction for Windows developers.

agents.one_line: BoardClaude has matured into a genuinely delightful product with a zero-install try flow, shareable results, and a functional board builder -- the two chronic gaps (builder preview, nav install CTA) are the remaining friction.

strengths: Genuine multi-turn agentic tool loop with search_codebase and read_file tools -- agents autonomously investigate code before scoring, running up to 5 rounds of tool calls with proper conversation replay. This is real agent architecture, not a wrapper.

Debate mechanism with structural score revisions is fully wired: parseRevisions() extracts REVISED lines, applyRevisions() mutates agent scores before synthesis, and revision context is injected into the synthesis prompt. Creates genuine emergent convergence.

Model routing is well-documented and justified: calibrated thinking budgets per agent role (boris=high/10K, thariq=max/20K, cat=medium/5K), appropriate model tier routing, free tier degrades to Haiku.
weaknesses: Cat's thinking budget remains at medium/5K despite previous action item to promote to high/10K. Cat is Opus with toolEnabled -- medium effort undersells the capability for nuanced product assessment.
1M context window is not meaningfully leveraged. BYOK tier caps at 400K chars for file content, and tool loop caps at budgetTokens+8000. No scenario approaches even half the available context.

No cross-iteration experiment harness or observability layer exists. No structured tracking of whether debate revisions improved accuracy, tool use changed scores, or cross-iteration feedback loops produce compound learning.

action_items.action: Promote Cat thinking budget to high/10K. Cat is Opus with tool_use enabled -- medium/5K is undersized for agentic workflow.
action_items.impact: Better product evaluation depth. Affects opus_usage (+3) and emergent_behavior (+2).

action_items.action: Add a lightweight metrics layer recording per-audit: tool calls per agent, debate revision count/deltas, cross-iteration score changes. Store alongside audit result.
action_items.impact: Addresses emergent_behavior (+5-8) by providing evidence of self-improvement.

action_items.action: Expand cross-iteration context to include debate transcript summaries and tool investigation findings from prior audits.
action_items.impact: Deepens cross-iteration feedback loop. Affects ai_innovation (+3) and emergent_behavior (+4).

action_items.action: Increase BYOK file budget or implement chunked analysis to leverage more of the 1M context window.
action_items.impact: Addresses opus_usage (+5) by leveraging flagship context window feature.

agents.one_line: Genuine multi-agent architecture with real agentic tool loops and debate-driven score revisions -- this is not a wrapper, but the self-improvement loop needs observability to prove compound intelligence.

strengths: TypeScript configuration is exemplary: strict mode, noUncheckedIndexedAccess, noImplicitReturns all enabled -- zero any types across entire src/, zero TS errors. isRecord type guard extracted to shared type-guards.ts and consistently consumed (P1 from iter-11 resolved).

Validation and test infrastructure is genuinely impressive: 148 passing tests covering validators, synthesis extractors, component rendering, integration tests, and API route tests. extractNumber/extractRadar/extractStringArray thoroughly tested with edge cases.

Accessibility treated as first-class: skip-to-content link, role=progressbar with aria-valuenow/min/max, aria-label on RadarChart, useReducedMotion in 8 files, aria-expanded, focus-visible ring styles, semantic HTML throughout.
weaknesses: Web results detail page (results/web/[auditId]/page.tsx) still uses fragile key={`item-${s ?? i}`} pattern. When s is nullish, falls back to index. EvaluationList component already solves this correctly -- but the page duplicates rendering instead of using it.
useReviewStream.ts lines 117-121 still uses bare as Record<string, unknown> casts for data.repo narrowing instead of the isRecord/isRepoInfo type guard pattern established in usePanelStream.ts.
try-invoke.ts fallback path (lines 330-397) defines local extractStringArray and extractActionItems helpers that duplicate the same logic already exported from try-synthesize.ts.

action_items.action: Refactor results/web/[auditId]/page.tsx to use EvaluationList component for strengths/weaknesses lists, eliminating fragile key={`item-${s ?? i}`} pattern and duplicated rendering.
action_items.impact: Fixes React key anti-pattern and removes ~50 lines of duplicated code.

action_items.action: Import isRecord from type-guards.ts and create isRepoInfo type guard in useReviewStream.ts to replace bare as casts. Consider extracting isRepoInfo to shared type-guards.ts.
action_items.impact: Eliminates last remaining bare type assertion casts in hooks.

action_items.action: In try-invoke.ts, replace locally-defined extractStringArray and extractActionItems with imports from try-synthesize.ts.
action_items.impact: Removes ~25 lines of duplicated validation logic.

action_items.action: Add Suspense boundaries around async data-fetching pages for more granular streaming SSR.
action_items.impact: Enables progressive rendering of page sections.

agents.one_line: A genuinely well-engineered dashboard with zero any types, 148 tests, exemplary accessibility, and strong type guard patterns -- remaining work is consolidating the last few duplicated paths into shared abstractions.

strengths: Prerequisites section now in README.md (lines 16-20) resolves iter-11 P1 action item -- developers see Node.js 20+, Claude Code, Git requirements before attempting install.

Accessibility is production-ready: skip-to-content link, semantic HTML throughout (header, nav, main, section, article), focus-visible on all interactive elements, useReducedMotion in AgentCard/RadarChart/PanelSynthesisView, ARIA labels on progressbars and charts.
Community infrastructure is complete: LICENSE (MIT), CONTRIBUTING.md, SECURITY.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, issue templates, PR template with a11y checklist, CI pipeline with 5 checks, 148 passing tests.
weaknesses: TSDoc comments missing on types.ts interfaces (iter-11 P2 still open) -- SynthesisReport, AgentEvaluation, PanelConfig have no JSDoc despite being canonical type definitions.
examples/ directory still missing (iter-11 P3 chronic) -- no examples/minimal-panel.yaml, custom-agent.md, or quickstart.md for copy-paste starting points.
Color contrast on small text: gray-400 on dark backgrounds is ~4.5:1 ratio (meets AA but not AAA for body text under 18pt).

action_items.action: Add TSDoc comments to all exported interfaces in types.ts -- at minimum SynthesisReport, AgentEvaluation, PanelConfig, PanelAgent, ActionItem with @example JSON.
action_items.impact: New contributors can understand types without reading implementation. Resolves chronic iter-11 P2.

action_items.action: Create examples/ directory with minimal-panel.yaml, quickstart.md, and custom-agent.md. Reference from README.
action_items.impact: Time-to-first-value drops from ~10 to <5 minutes. Resolves chronic iter-11 P3.

action_items.action: Replace text-gray-400 with text-gray-300 for all text-sm labels in interactive components to meet WCAG AAA contrast.
action_items.impact: Improves readability for users with low vision.

agents.one_line: Prerequisites are in, accessibility is solid, community files are complete, but TSDoc on types.ts and the examples directory are chronic misses that prevent this from being an A.

strengths: Outstanding narrative clarity: One-sentence pitch is perfect for non-developers. README has compelling story arc. Demo SVG shows concrete before/after (68->84), proving value immediately.

Production-grade error handling and integration: P1 action item RESOLVED -- usePanelStream.ts maps all route.ts error codes to user-actionable messages. CI/CD complete. 148 tests. Copy-link sharing added.

Strong community foundation: 4 panel templates ship out-of-box. CONTRIBUTING.md, SECURITY.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, issue templates, PR template. install.sh one-command install. Try It lowers barrier to zero.
weaknesses: npm package not published: No package.json at repo root, no @boardclaude/cli on npm. Install requires git clone + manual copy. Blocks mainstream adoption.
Internationalization still hardcoded: messages.ts centralizes English strings but no next-intl wiring, no locale switching, no proof-of-concept. HTML lang='en' hardcoded. No RTL consideration.

Accessibility gaps for screen readers: Form error announcements could use aria-live regions. No keyboard shortcut documentation. Color-only status indicators lack text alternatives for colorblind users.

action_items.action: Publish @boardclaude/cli to npm with npx install command. Add package.json at repo root with bin entry.
action_items.impact: Mainstream developer adoption path. community_impact +10-15.

action_items.action: Implement next-intl with en/es locale switching proof-of-concept. Wire useLocale hook, externalize date formatting, add locale selector.
action_items.impact: Proves global readiness. internationalization +30-35.

action_items.action: Add aria-live='polite' regions for dynamic status updates. Document keyboard shortcuts. Add text labels to color-coded indicators.
action_items.impact: Screen reader users can use Try It feature. community_impact +5.

agents.one_line: Exceptional narrative and integration execution, but npm packaging and real i18n implementation remain unfulfilled promises limiting global community reach.

top_strengths: 148 passing tests with TypeScript strict mode, noUncheckedIndexedAccess, zero any types -- genuinely production-grade verification across validators, extractors, components, integration, and SSE hook state machines

Multi-turn agentic tool loops (search_codebase, read_file) for 3/6 agents, debate-driven score revisions with applyRevisions(), and clean module decomposition (try-invoke, try-debate, try-synthesize, route.ts) -- real AI architecture, not a wrapper
Zero-install Try It flow with shareable results (Copy Link), Board Builder for custom panels, and 4 panel templates -- transforms from single-use tool into a platform with genuine product-market fit
top_weaknesses: try-invoke.ts fallback path duplicates validation logic that already exists in try-synthesize.ts exports -- flagged by Boris, Lydia, and synthesis across 2 iterations
Internationalization remains at string extraction stage only (messages.ts) with no next-intl wiring, locale switching, or RTL support -- Jason's i18n score stuck at 50 across iterations
No observability/metrics layer for self-improvement loop -- no tracking of debate revision impact, tool use effect on scores, or compound learning evidence across iterations

agent_a.position: Compound learning is real: 12 iterations tracked, 61/71 items resolved, score trajectory from 68.4 to 85.46 with measurable improvement

agent_b.position: Self-improvement loop remains anecdotal -- no structured tracking of whether debate revisions, tool use, or cross-iteration context actually improve outcomes

divergent_opinions.analysis: Both are right: the score trajectory proves learning happened, but the system cannot explain why it happened. Boris measures outcomes, Thariq wants mechanisms.

action_items.action: Refactor try-invoke.ts fallback path (lines 329-397) to import and use extractNumber/extractStringArray/extractActionItems from try-synthesize.ts instead of duplicating validation logic inline
action_items.impact: Eliminates ~40 lines of duplicated validation, ensures single source of truth for extraction helpers

action_items.action: Refactor results/web/[auditId]/page.tsx to use EvaluationList component for strengths/weaknesses, replacing fragile key={`item-${s ?? i}`} pattern
action_items.impact: Fixes React key anti-pattern and removes ~50 lines of duplicated rendering code

action_items.action: Enable toolEnabled: true for the Lydia agent in try-agents.ts and promote Cat's thinking budget to high/10K
action_items.impact: 4/6 agents with tool access, better product evaluation depth from Cat

action_items.action: Import isRecord and create isRepoInfo type guard in useReviewStream.ts to replace bare as Record<string, unknown> casts
action_items.impact: Eliminates last remaining bare type assertion casts in hooks, full type guard consistency

action_items.action: Add integration tests for debate pipeline (parseRevisions, identifyDebatePairs, SCORE_REVISION_BOUND) and applyRevisions in route.ts
action_items.impact: Tests correctness-critical debate paths with ~12-15 new tests

action_items.action: Add TSDoc comments to exported interfaces in types.ts (SynthesisReport, AgentEvaluation, PanelConfig) with @example JSON
action_items.impact: Contributors understand types via IDE hover. Chronic iter-11 P2.

action_items.action: Create examples/ directory with minimal-panel.yaml, quickstart.md, and custom-agent.md. Reference from README.
action_items.impact: Time-to-first-value drops to <5 minutes. Chronic iter-11 P3.

action_items.action: Add lightweight per-audit metrics layer recording tool calls per agent, debate revisions, cross-iteration score changes
action_items.impact: Proves compound learning with data, enables tuning of thinking budgets and tool access

action_items.action: Publish @boardclaude/cli to npm with npx install command
action_items.impact: Mainstream adoption path. Moves from git-clone-only to npm-standard.

action_items.action: Implement full next-intl i18n: wire messages.ts through next-intl, add real translations for en/es/fr/de/ja/zh/ar (with RTL support for ar), locale switcher in UI, dynamic HTML lang attribute. Key languages must have complete translations, not stubs.
action_items.impact: Proves global readiness and real international awareness. Internationalization scores +30-35 across Jason and other agents. Previous half-implementation caused score regression â€” must be complete.

items_resolved_from_previous: Cat and Thariq now have toolEnabled: true (3/6 agentic)
Copy Link button added to PanelSynthesisView (Cat P1)
isRecord extracted to shared type-guards.ts (Lydia P1)
Debate has score revisions via applyRevisions()

debate.reason: No agent pairs exceeded divergence threshold of 15. Max related-criteria delta was 9 (thariq.ai_innovation=82 vs boris.compound_learning=91). Scores are converging.
